lines.text: [first lines]
Mark my words, Mariah, we'll discover the thriving metropolis of Riverton just around the bend.
Right where it's always been - unless somebody moved it.
Great little town, Riverton. Filled with people hungering for amusement; thirsty for refinement. Mariah, every cowboy in the county will be on board tonight.
And pay good money to see our show? Cowboys like beef, not ham.
How much money did those robbers get?
They got everything but the wastebasket - better than forty grand.
And I talked those boys into putting the money where it was safe!
[Patsy's father is wanted on bank robbery charges]
Oh, Patsy, honey, we know how you feel and we're sorry, dear - only crying isn't going to help any. Now's the time you've got to learn to be a real trouper. C'mon, keep your little chin up!
[Gene and Frog negotiate their salary as riverboat entertainers]
If you're talkin' about money, I think we can agree on that.
Yeah! Personally, I'd work for peanuts - just room and board.
[Captain Bartlett eyes the portly Frog dubiously]
From the looks of you, that wouldn't be peanuts.
[Patsy give Gene a big kiss as a reward for rescuing her from drowning]
Let's get out of here before they start playing post office.
Say, did you ever feel like a rat?
Well, no. I had one one time, though. He was a cute little fellow with pink ears.
[last lines]
I'll be leaving town right after the show. I'm sure going to miss you. You've been awfully good to me.
It's going to be fine for you, Patsy. Living out on Gene's ranch, you'll have a good time and you'll be able to go to school.
Every time we play Riverton, we'll stay at the ranch
Will you bring Sally?
[eyeing Gene singing romantically to Sally]
From the looks of things, Sally will be bringing us.
